pageTitle: Ehsan Adil | Pakistan Cricket | Cricket Players and Officials | ESPN Cricinfo
TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {42908=Jul 5, 2015, 55295=The Cricket Monthly: Firdose Moonda on the joys, and complexities, of cricket commentary in Xhosa TCM July issue, 60295=4391 runs after 35, and 2354 outside top five, 13143=Born March 15, 1993, Sheikhupura, 44558=Jun 23, 2015, 11783=Umar Gul, 63760=Since the beginning of 2012, Ian Bell averages 34.69 when batting in the top six; among regular top-order batsmen, only Shane Watson has a lower average, 39052=The faith in Adil's ability came from his performances in his maiden first-class season, in 2012-13. He was a member of Pakistan's Under-19 team in the 2012 World Cup in Australia, and later that year made his first-class debut for Habib Bank, taking six wickets in his first game. Adil finished as the second-highest wicket-taker in the President's Trophy, the four-day domestic competition, taking 54 wickets at 17.88. Those numbers earned him a place in the Pakistan squad for the Test series in South Africa, and when Junaid Khan and Umar Gul were both unavailable for the Centurion game, Adil walked in for his Test debut in a three-man Pakistan pace attack that had a combined prior experience of two Tests. ESPNcricinfo staff, 43743=Jul 3, 2015, 11585=Taufeeq Umar}
